<div class="BlogTitleClass wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2025-06-11T13:08:59+00:00">11 June 2025</time></div>

<figure class="BlogImageClass wp-block-post-featured-image"><img width="1624" height="885" src="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/inside_the_black_box.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" style="object-fit:cover;" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/inside_the_black_box.png 1624w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/inside_the_black_box-300x163.png 300w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/inside_the_black_box-1024x558.png 1024w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/inside_the_black_box-768x419.png 768w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/inside_the_black_box-1536x837.png 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 1624px) 100vw, 1624px" /></figure>

<h2 class="has-text-align-center wp-block-post-title">What open-weight LLMs today can (and can&#8217;t) do</h2></div>


<div class="entry-content BlogTextClass wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The recent wave of open-weight LLMs are leveling the playing field &#8211; allowing developers to build robust, privacy-friendly and cost-efficient NLP applications with full control and ownership. Instead of relying on a closed model like GPT4, Claude or Gemini, you now have the luxury of choice when picking an open model to run/deploy locally or on your favourite cloud. </p>
<p>But which open model suits your application best?</p>
<p>ü¶ú For multi-linguality, go with the recent DeepSeek AI v3, Google DeepMind&#8217;s Gemma 3 (except 1b) or Qwen 3, which are all supporting more than 100 languages. If you need to cover multi-modality, there&#8217;s a huge variety to pick from, including Gemma 3 or DeepSeek Janus Pro.</p>
<p>ü§ñ Good reasoning models include DeepSeek R1, Qwen 3, Tencent&#8217;s HunYuan Turbo S and Magistral (released by Mistral AI 2 days ago). Agentic support like o3 and Clause is offered by Qwen 3 and Qwen-Agent, as well as as Gemma 3.</p>
<p>üìö If you need a looooong context window, Meta&#8217;s Llama 4 has got you covered with Maverick (1M) &#038; Scout (10M !!!). In fact, most recent open models support at least 128K tokens, which is pretty much a full novel. </p>
<p>üêû Size matters &#8211; so if you want to run on mobile or edge devices, you can pick any of the 1B models (e.g. Qwen 3, Falcon 3, Llama 3), a SmolLM by Hugging Face, or a larger one if your hardware can handle it. Remember, a quantized version of a larger model often works better than an original smaller model. </p>
<p>üë©‚Äçüè´ Plenty of open MoE models available as well if you&#8217;re looking to maximise cost efficiency. There&#8217;s Llama 4 Maverick (400B, 17B active), OLMoE (7B, 1.3 active) or Mixtral (46.7B, 12.9B active), among others. </p>
<p>‚ú® Finally, a shout out to Ai2 and their truly open source model OLMo. Great to see the data, training code and evaluations all fully available, allowing actual reproduction and better tracking of data sources. Love this! ü´∂<br />
</span></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Slides</b>: <a href="https://speakerdeck.com/sofievl/2025-06-11-ai-belgium" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Speakerdeck</a></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Venue</b>: AI Belgium meetup (Brussels)</p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Full article</b>: <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/posts/sofievanlandeghem_2025-06-11-aibelgium-activity-7338936339570061313-W7UH/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">LinkedIn</a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>

		<script>
			const tl = gsap.timeline({
				scrollTrigger: {
					trigger: "#hero",
					start: "top top",
					end: "bottom top",
					scrub: true
				}
			});

			gsap.utils.toArray(".parallax").forEach(layer => {
				const depth = layer.dataset.depth;
				const movement = -(layer.offsetHeight * depth)
				tl.to(layer, {y: movement, ease: "none"}, 0)
			});
		</script>
		
		<script>
			/* When the user scrolls down, hide the navbar. When the user scrolls up, show the navbar */
			var prevScrollpos = window.pageYOffset;
			window.onscroll = function() {
				var currentScrollPos = window.pageYOffset;								
				
				var x = window.matchMedia("(min-width: 1851px)")
				if(x.matches) {
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/

					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
				else{
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/
					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
					/* 	document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
			
				if(currentScrollPos == "0.0") {
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "0.5em";
					<!-- document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = 'auto'; -->
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0.8em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "auto";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "40em";
				}
				if (prevScrollpos > currentScrollPos) {
					
				} else {					
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.cssText += 'height:auto;';
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "-1.0em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "2.5em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "100%";					
				}
				prevScrollpos = currentScrollPos;
			}
		</script></footer></main>

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

<section id="Main" class="main">
 <section id="intro" class="intro">
  <div class="title">Sofie‚Äôs Blog</div>
</section>
 <section id="Blog" class="Blog" style="Padding: 0 0 0 0">
<div class="container">															



<main class="wp-block-group is-layout-flow wp-block-group-is-layout-flow">
<div class="wp-block-group has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-group-is-layout-constrained">
<div style="height:var(--wp--preset--spacing--50)" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full avatarBlog"><img width="145" height="145" src="http://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Blog.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-33"/></figure>


<div class="BlogTitleClass wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2025-05-31T10:10:29+00:00">31 May 2025</time></div>

<figure class="BlogImageClass wp-block-post-featured-image"><img width="1920" height="1081" src="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/keynote_pyconitalia.jpg" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" style="object-fit:cover;" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/keynote_pyconitalia.jpg 1920w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/keynote_pyconitalia-300x169.jpg 300w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/keynote_pyconitalia-1024x577.jpg 1024w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/keynote_pyconitalia-768x432.jpg 768w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/keynote_pyconitalia-1536x865.jpg 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 1920px) 100vw, 1920px" /></figure>

<h2 class="has-text-align-center wp-block-post-title">Data doesn&#8217;t lie ‚Äî but it can mislead: How to ensure integrity of your Machine Learning applications</h2></div>


<div class="entry-content BlogTextClass wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><p><span style="font-weight: 400;">A meaningful evaluation framework is crucial to the success of any Machine Learning (ML) application, yet structural biases often creep in unknowingly. When this happens, the results may not be as reliable as they initially appear. </p>
<p>This talk identifies common pitfalls and illustrates them with real-world examples from nearly two decades of experience in the data science field. We explore the hidden story behind the performance metrics, moving beyond a single F-measure or accuracy score to delve into the intricacies of the data set and its domain. We discuss how to identify artificial biases in your data and offer strategies for preventing them through rigorous design of your data collection and annotation processes. </p>
<p>Ultimately, this talk provides a list of practical recommendations for building ML projects on solid foundations. Because amid the current AI boom and hype, we urgently need high-quality datasets, meaningful evaluations, and robust algorithms to ensure we are not just building elaborate sandcastles with GPUs.</span></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Venue</b>: PyCon Italia (Bologna)</p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Video</b>: <a href="https://youtu.be/qXx-4m-Z0q4?t=29341" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Recording of presentation, in raw stream (8:09:01 &#8211; 8:55:25)</a></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Slides</b>: <a href="https://speakerdeck.com/sofievl/2025-05-31-pycon-italia" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Speakerdeck</a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
</section>

		<script>
			const tl = gsap.timeline({
				scrollTrigger: {
					trigger: "#hero",
					start: "top top",
					end: "bottom top",
					scrub: true
				}
			});

			gsap.utils.toArray(".parallax").forEach(layer => {
				const depth = layer.dataset.depth;
				const movement = -(layer.offsetHeight * depth)
				tl.to(layer, {y: movement, ease: "none"}, 0)
			});
		</script>
		
		<script>
			/* When the user scrolls down, hide the navbar. When the user scrolls up, show the navbar */
			var prevScrollpos = window.pageYOffset;
			window.onscroll = function() {
				var currentScrollPos = window.pageYOffset;								
				
				var x = window.matchMedia("(min-width: 1851px)")
				if(x.matches) {
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/

					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
				else{
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/
					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
					/* 	document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
			
				if(currentScrollPos == "0.0") {
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "0.5em";
					<!-- document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = 'auto'; -->
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0.8em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "auto";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "40em";
				}
				if (prevScrollpos > currentScrollPos) {
					
				} else {					
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.cssText += 'height:auto;';
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "-1.0em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "2.5em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "100%";					
				}
				prevScrollpos = currentScrollPos;
			}
		</script></footer></main>

{"prefetch":[{"source":"document","where":{"and":[{"href_matches":"\/*"},{"not":{"href_matches":["\/wp-*.php","\/wp-admin\/*","\/wp-content\/uploads\/*","\/wp-content\/*","\/wp-content\/plugins\/*","\/wp-content\/themes\/twentytwentyfour\/*","\/*\\?(.+)"]}},{"not":{"selector_matches":"a[rel~=\"nofollow\"]"}},{"not":{"selector_matches":".no-prefetch, .no-prefetch a"}}]},"eagerness":"conservative"}]}

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

<div class="BlogTitleClass wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2025-03-12T11:16:08+00:00">12 March 2025</time></div>

<figure class="BlogImageClass wp-block-post-featured-image"><img width="2000" height="1500" src="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/gemma3.jpg" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="Gemma3 Long Context Recipe" style="object-fit:cover;" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/gemma3.jpg 2000w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/gemma3-300x225.jpg 300w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/gemma3-1024x768.jpg 1024w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/gemma3-768x576.jpg 768w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/gemma3-1536x1152.jpg 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 2000px) 100vw, 2000px" /></figure>

<h2 class="has-text-align-center wp-block-post-title">Gemma 3 open-weights models</h2></div>


<div class="entry-content BlogTextClass wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><p><span style="font-weight: 400;">I was fortunate to be invited to the Gemma Developer Day at Google Paris, where the Gemma 3 family of open-weight models was officially launched. üöÄ</p>
<p>The 1b is a text-only model (no vision encoder) focused on English and a great candidate for integration on your favourite edge device &#8211; running on a single GPU. The 4b, 12b and 27b models support over 140 languages and are multi-modal. Further, Google provides quantized versions of the Gemma 3 models in three weight representations: per-channel int4, per-block int4, and switched fp8. They&#8217;ve also significantly extended the context window from Gemma 2 (8k) to 128k.</p>
<p>While the benchmark results certainly look impressive, with the instruction-tuned 27b model achieving a great ranking on the Chatbot Arena as well (currently 1339), the proof will be in pudding! Looking forward to taking these open models for a spin and see what they can do on a realistic use-case.<br />
</span></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;">‚Üí  <a href="https://blog.google/technology/developers/gemma-3/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Google&#8217;s blog post</a></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;">‚Üí  <a href="https://storage.googleapis.com/deepmind-media/gemma/Gemma3Report.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Gemma 3&#8217;s technical report</a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
</section>

		<script>
			const tl = gsap.timeline({
				scrollTrigger: {
					trigger: "#hero",
					start: "top top",
					end: "bottom top",
					scrub: true
				}
			});

			gsap.utils.toArray(".parallax").forEach(layer => {
				const depth = layer.dataset.depth;
				const movement = -(layer.offsetHeight * depth)
				tl.to(layer, {y: movement, ease: "none"}, 0)
			});
		</script>
		
		<script>
			/* When the user scrolls down, hide the navbar. When the user scrolls up, show the navbar */
			var prevScrollpos = window.pageYOffset;
			window.onscroll = function() {
				var currentScrollPos = window.pageYOffset;								
				
				var x = window.matchMedia("(min-width: 1851px)")
				if(x.matches) {
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/

					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
				else{
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/
					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
					/* 	document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
			
				if(currentScrollPos == "0.0") {
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "0.5em";
					<!-- document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = 'auto'; -->
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0.8em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "auto";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "40em";
				}
				if (prevScrollpos > currentScrollPos) {
					
				} else {					
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.cssText += 'height:auto;';
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "-1.0em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "2.5em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "100%";					
				}
				prevScrollpos = currentScrollPos;
			}
		</script></footer></main>

{"prefetch":[{"source":"document","where":{"and":[{"href_matches":"\/*"},{"not":{"href_matches":["\/wp-*.php","\/wp-admin\/*","\/wp-content\/uploads\/*","\/wp-content\/*","\/wp-content\/plugins\/*","\/wp-content\/themes\/twentytwentyfour\/*","\/*\\?(.+)"]}},{"not":{"selector_matches":"a[rel~=\"nofollow\"]"}},{"not":{"selector_matches":".no-prefetch, .no-prefetch a"}}]},"eagerness":"conservative"}]}

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

<div class="BlogTitleClass wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2024-06-28T12:38:07+00:00">28 June 2024</time></div>

<figure class="BlogImageClass wp-block-post-featured-image"><img width="2016" height="1512" src="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/iacta.jpg" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="Grey cat luying in bed, looking sleepily at the camera" style="object-fit:cover;" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/iacta.jpg 2016w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/iacta-300x225.jpg 300w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/iacta-1024x768.jpg 1024w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/iacta-768x576.jpg 768w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/iacta-1536x1152.jpg 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 2016px) 100vw, 2016px" /></figure>

<h2 class="has-text-align-center wp-block-post-title">Once a Maintainer: Sofie Van Landeghem</h2></div>


<div class="entry-content BlogTextClass wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Allison Pike interviewed me about my work as a core maintainer of spaCy and Typer. We ended up talking about how I got into NLP in the first place, the disconnect between research and industry applications, and how to manage an Open-Source project. We discussed how to organize Github branches, Python dependencies, as well as my love for types and cats.</span></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Interview</b>: <a href="https://onceamaintainer.substack.com/p/once-a-maintainer-sofie-van-landeghem" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Once a maintainer substack</a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
</section>

		<script>
			const tl = gsap.timeline({
				scrollTrigger: {
					trigger: "#hero",
					start: "top top",
					end: "bottom top",
					scrub: true
				}
			});

			gsap.utils.toArray(".parallax").forEach(layer => {
				const depth = layer.dataset.depth;
				const movement = -(layer.offsetHeight * depth)
				tl.to(layer, {y: movement, ease: "none"}, 0)
			});
		</script>
		
		<script>
			/* When the user scrolls down, hide the navbar. When the user scrolls up, show the navbar */
			var prevScrollpos = window.pageYOffset;
			window.onscroll = function() {
				var currentScrollPos = window.pageYOffset;								
				
				var x = window.matchMedia("(min-width: 1851px)")
				if(x.matches) {
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/

					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
				else{
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/
					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
					/* 	document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
			
				if(currentScrollPos == "0.0") {
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "0.5em";
					<!-- document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = 'auto'; -->
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0.8em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "auto";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "40em";
				}
				if (prevScrollpos > currentScrollPos) {
					
				} else {					
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.cssText += 'height:auto;';
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "-1.0em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "2.5em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "100%";					
				}
				prevScrollpos = currentScrollPos;
			}
		</script></footer></main>

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

  <div class="title">Sofie‚Äôs Blog</div>

 <section id="Blog" class="Blog" style="Padding: 0 0 0 0">
<div class="container">															



<main class="wp-block-group is-layout-flow wp-block-group-is-layout-flow">
<div class="wp-block-group has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-group-is-layout-constrained">
<div style="height:var(--wp--preset--spacing--50)" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full avatarBlog"><img width="145" height="145" src="http://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Blog.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-33"/></figure>


<div class="BlogTitleClass wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2024-06-16T12:22:00+00:00">16 June 2024</time></div>

<figure class="BlogImageClass wp-block-post-featured-image"><img width="1025" height="769" src="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/recommendations-e1719923752194.jpg" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" style="object-fit:cover;" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" /></figure>

<h2 class="has-text-align-center wp-block-post-title">How to uncover and avoid structural biases in your ML projects</h2></div>


<div class="entry-content BlogTextClass wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Even with today&#8217;s impressive zero-shot LLM capabilities, the success of any NLP project can be predicted by the quality of the data it&#8217;s built on. First and foremost, you need a representative evaluation data set to measure progress and performance throughout the development of your NLP pipeline. Further, once you get to production, you&#8217;ll need to balance accuracy versus a whole range of other performance measures, such as reliability, reproducability, interpretability, inference speed and compute power &#8211; to name just a few. You might just find that training a smaller, specialized supervised model is more cost efficient and robust than running a black-box LLM.</p>
<p>Either way: data should be front and center throughout the development of your NLP pipeline. But as we all know: bias can creep in. I urge any data scientist to not just look at the performance numbers, but actually dig into the data itself, understand how it was selected for processing in the first place, and whether the data you&#8217;ve collected is actually representative of the use-cases you&#8217;ll want to apply your model on. This may seem like a given, but in many cases there&#8217;s actually a mismatch between the two, and assumptions about data and data processing pipelines are often proven false halfway through the project. </p>
<p>Bias can also creep into your evaluation. You might be artificially boosting your numbers by accidentally leaking information from training to test &#8212; this happens in more ways that you can imagine! Setting up an &#8220;extrinsic&#8221; evaluation will also help you better understand the final target of your NLP pipeline and how it should integrate with downstream requirements. This allows you to step back from the nitty-gritty details of training your ML/NLP model, and keep the bigger picture in mind while iterating over your data model, NLP algorithms and overall solution.</p>
<p>At PyData London, I talked through some use-cases, inspired by various consulting projects from the last decade, and compiled a list of recommendations for running an ML project &#8211; focusing mostly on data and evaluation.</p>
<p>Here&#8217;s my (biased) list of recommendations, taken from 15+ years of experience in the field:</p>
<p>&#8211; Avoid selection bias by formalizing the selection procedure<br />
&#8211; Create deterministic, document-level train/dev/test splits<br />
&#8211; Carefully design the data model / label scheme<br />
&#8211; Write up detailed data guidelines<br />
&#8211; Set up a meaningful extrinsic evaluation<br />
&#8211; Look at inter-annotator agreement stats and plot a learning curve<br />
&#8211; Apply a preliminary model back to the training data<br />
&#8211; Manually inspect gold annotations and incorrect predictions<br />
&#8211; Make sure you&#8217;re climbing the right hill<br />
&#8211; Data quality should be front and center!</p>
<p>Happy data mining!</span></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Venue</b>: London PyData</p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Video</b>: <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4gcGkFAG7OA&#038;list=PL9MH-RvVdgbVl0wG8cHU2JQ657GdQ7Kc0&#038;index=1" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Recording of presentation</a></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Slides</b>: <a href="https://speakerdeck.com/sofievl/2024-06-16-pydata-london/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Speakerdeck</a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</section>

		<script src="https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/s.cdpn.io/16327/ScrollTrigger.min.js"></script>
		<script src="https://frogcat.github.io/canvas-arrow/canvas-arrow.js"></script>
		
		<script>
			const tl = gsap.timeline({
				scrollTrigger: {
					trigger: "#hero",
					start: "top top",
					end: "bottom top",
					scrub: true
				}
			});

			gsap.utils.toArray(".parallax").forEach(layer => {
				const depth = layer.dataset.depth;
				const movement = -(layer.offsetHeight * depth)
				tl.to(layer, {y: movement, ease: "none"}, 0)
			});
		</script>
		
		<script>
			/* When the user scrolls down, hide the navbar. When the user scrolls up, show the navbar */
			var prevScrollpos = window.pageYOffset;
			window.onscroll = function() {
				var currentScrollPos = window.pageYOffset;								
				
				var x = window.matchMedia("(min-width: 1851px)")
				if(x.matches) {
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/

					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
				else{
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/
					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
					/* 	document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
			
				if(currentScrollPos == "0.0") {
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "0.5em";
					<!-- document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = 'auto'; -->
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0.8em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "auto";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "40em";
				}
				if (prevScrollpos > currentScrollPos) {
					
				} else {					
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.cssText += 'height:auto;';
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "-1.0em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "2.5em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "100%";					
				}
				prevScrollpos = currentScrollPos;
			}
		</script></footer></main>
</div>
<script type="speculationrules">
{"prefetch":[{"source":"document","where":{"and":[{"href_matches":"\/*"},{"not":{"href_matches":["\/wp-*.php","\/wp-admin\/*","\/wp-content\/uploads\/*","\/wp-content\/*","\/wp-content\/plugins\/*","\/wp-content\/themes\/twentytwentyfour\/*","\/*\\?(.+)"]}},{"not":{"selector_matches":"a[rel~=\"nofollow\"]"}},{"not":{"selector_matches":".no-prefetch, .no-prefetch a"}}]},"eagerness":"conservative"}]}
</script>
<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>
</body>
</html>

:root :where(.wp-block-post-title a:where(:not(.wp-element-button)):hover){text-decoration: underline;}
</style>

<figure class="wp-block-image size-full avatarBlog"><img width="145" height="145" src="http://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Blog.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-33"/></figure>


<div class="BlogTitleClass wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2024-01-23T10:25:00+00:00">23 January 2024</time></div>

<figure class="BlogImageClass wp-block-post-featured-image"><img width="1920" height="1080" src="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2024_01_23_az.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="Slide showing how to use built-in zero-shot NER with spacy-llm" style="object-fit:cover;" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2024_01_23_az.png 1920w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2024_01_23_az-300x169.png 300w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2024_01_23_az-1024x576.png 1024w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2024_01_23_az-768x432.png 768w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2024_01_23_az-1536x864.png 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 1920px) 100vw, 1920px" /></figure>

<h2 class="has-text-align-center wp-block-post-title">From quick prototyping with LLMs to more reliable and efficient NLP solutions</h2></div>


<div class="entry-content BlogTextClass wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Due to their impressive natural language capabilities, large language models (LLMs) are paving the way for fast prototyping of NLP applications in any domain. In this talk, I showcase how to build a structured NLP pipeline to mine clinical trials, using the open-source NLP toolbox spaCy and its recent extension &#8216;spacy-llm&#8217;. Moving beyond a fast prototype, she&#8217;ll discuss how to manage different performance features such as accuracy, speed, memory usage, reliability, maintainability and customizability, and offer pragmatic solutions to make the pipeline more reliable and cost efficient.</span></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Venue</b>: AstraZeneca NLP Community of Practice (external speaker, online)</p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Slides</b>: <a href="https://speakerdeck.com/sofievl/2024-01-23-az" target="_blank" rel="noopener">SpeakerDeck</a></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Repo</b>: <a href="https://github.com/explosion/spacy-llm/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Github</a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
</section>

		<script>
			const tl = gsap.timeline({
				scrollTrigger: {
					trigger: "#hero",
					start: "top top",
					end: "bottom top",
					scrub: true
				}
			});

			gsap.utils.toArray(".parallax").forEach(layer => {
				const depth = layer.dataset.depth;
				const movement = -(layer.offsetHeight * depth)
				tl.to(layer, {y: movement, ease: "none"}, 0)
			});
		</script>
		
		<script>
			/* When the user scrolls down, hide the navbar. When the user scrolls up, show the navbar */
			var prevScrollpos = window.pageYOffset;
			window.onscroll = function() {
				var currentScrollPos = window.pageYOffset;								
				
				var x = window.matchMedia("(min-width: 1851px)")
				if(x.matches) {
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/

					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
				else{
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/
					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
					/* 	document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
			
				if(currentScrollPos == "0.0") {
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "0.5em";
					<!-- document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = 'auto'; -->
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0.8em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "auto";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "40em";
				}
				if (prevScrollpos > currentScrollPos) {
					
				} else {					
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.cssText += 'height:auto;';
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "-1.0em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "2.5em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "100%";					
				}
				prevScrollpos = currentScrollPos;
			}
		</script></footer></main>

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

 <section id="Blog" class="Blog" style="Padding: 0 0 0 0">

<main class="wp-block-group is-layout-flow wp-block-group-is-layout-flow">
<div class="wp-block-group has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-group-is-layout-constrained">

<figure class="wp-block-image size-full avatarBlog"><img width="145" height="145" src="http://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Blog.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-33"/></figure>


<div class="BlogTitleClass wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2023-11-02T10:21:00+00:00">2 November 2023</time></div>

<figure class="BlogImageClass wp-block-post-featured-image"><img width="2039" height="318" src="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2023_11_02_github.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="Github overview of contributions" style="object-fit:cover;" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2023_11_02_github.png 2039w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2023_11_02_github-300x47.png 300w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2023_11_02_github-1024x160.png 1024w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2023_11_02_github-768x120.png 768w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2023_11_02_github-1536x240.png 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 2039px) 100vw, 2039px" /></figure>

<h2 class="has-text-align-center wp-block-post-title">How to get the most out of your open-source contributions?</h2></div>


<div class="entry-content BlogTextClass wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><p>As a core maintainer of a largeish open-source library, I&#8217;m often asked for guidelines on how to collaborate efficiently on a code base, as a team. In particular, typical questions involve Pull Requests (PRs): how to get your own contributions approved more easily/quickly on the one hand, and how to do effective code reviews on the other hand.</p>
<p>This week, I&#8217;m celebrating 10 years of contributing open-source code on Github, and I wanted to share some tips &amp; tricks from my own personal experience. In this post, I highlight both the contributor&#8217;s perspective as well as the reviewer&#8217;s angle, explaining how to showcase the value of your work clearly, and how to be as effective and helpful as possible when you&#8217;re reviewing.</p>
<p>Happy reading!</p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Full article</b>: <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/how-get-most-out-your-open-source-contributions-sofie-van-landeghem-ts1ye/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">LinkedIn</a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
</section>
<footer class="wp-block-template-part"><!-- Footer -->
			<section id="footer">

		<script>
			const tl = gsap.timeline({
				scrollTrigger: {
					trigger: "#hero",
					start: "top top",
					end: "bottom top",
					scrub: true
				}
			});

			gsap.utils.toArray(".parallax").forEach(layer => {
				const depth = layer.dataset.depth;
				const movement = -(layer.offsetHeight * depth)
				tl.to(layer, {y: movement, ease: "none"}, 0)
			});
		</script>
		
		<script>
			/* When the user scrolls down, hide the navbar. When the user scrolls up, show the navbar */
			var prevScrollpos = window.pageYOffset;
			window.onscroll = function() {
				var currentScrollPos = window.pageYOffset;								
				
				var x = window.matchMedia("(min-width: 1851px)")
				if(x.matches) {
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/

					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
				else{
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/
					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
					/* 	document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
			
				if(currentScrollPos == "0.0") {
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "0.5em";
					<!-- document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = 'auto'; -->
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0.8em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "auto";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "40em";
				}
				if (prevScrollpos > currentScrollPos) {
					
				} else {					
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.cssText += 'height:auto;';
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "-1.0em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "2.5em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "100%";					
				}
				prevScrollpos = currentScrollPos;
			}
		</script></footer></main>

{"prefetch":[{"source":"document","where":{"and":[{"href_matches":"\/*"},{"not":{"href_matches":["\/wp-*.php","\/wp-admin\/*","\/wp-content\/uploads\/*","\/wp-content\/*","\/wp-content\/plugins\/*","\/wp-content\/themes\/twentytwentyfour\/*","\/*\\?(.+)"]}},{"not":{"selector_matches":"a[rel~=\"nofollow\"]"}},{"not":{"selector_matches":".no-prefetch, .no-prefetch a"}}]},"eagerness":"conservative"}]}

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

<div class="BlogTitleClass wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2023-06-19T00:00:00+00:00">19 June 2023</time></div>

<figure class="BlogImageClass wp-block-post-featured-image"><img width="2048" height="1152" src="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/2023_06_19_NLP_Meetup.jpg" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="Picture of Sofie presenting her talk at the Belgian NLP meetup" style="object-fit:cover;" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/2023_06_19_NLP_Meetup.jpg 2048w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/2023_06_19_NLP_Meetup-300x169.jpg 300w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/2023_06_19_NLP_Meetup-1024x576.jpg 1024w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/2023_06_19_NLP_Meetup-768x432.jpg 768w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/2023_06_19_NLP_Meetup-1536x864.jpg 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 2048px) 100vw, 2048px" /></figure>

<h2 class="has-text-align-center wp-block-post-title">Integrating Large Language Models into structured NLP pipelines</h2></div>


<div class="entry-content BlogTextClass wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Due to their impressive natural language capabilities, recent large language models (LLMs) are paving the way for fast prototyping of NLP applications in any business domain. Most practical use-cases however will benefit from a structured, pipeline approach in which LLMs can be complemented with supervised models or even rule-based approaches. In this talk, I showcase how to build such a structured pipeline with the open-source NLP toolbox spaCy, and its recent extension &#8216;spacy-llm&#8217;. I discuss how to design a production-ready NLP pipeline, while managing different (and occassionally conflicting) performance features such as accuracy, speed, memory usage, reliability, maintainability and customizability.</span></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Venue</b>: <span style="font-weight: 400;">Belgian NLP meetup</span></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Slides</b>: <a href="https://speakerdeck.com/sofievl/2023-06-19-spacyllm" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Speakerdeck</a></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Repo</b>: <a href="https://github.com/explosion/spacy-llm/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Github</a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
</section>

		<script>
			const tl = gsap.timeline({
				scrollTrigger: {
					trigger: "#hero",
					start: "top top",
					end: "bottom top",
					scrub: true
				}
			});

			gsap.utils.toArray(".parallax").forEach(layer => {
				const depth = layer.dataset.depth;
				const movement = -(layer.offsetHeight * depth)
				tl.to(layer, {y: movement, ease: "none"}, 0)
			});
		</script>
		
		<script>
			/* When the user scrolls down, hide the navbar. When the user scrolls up, show the navbar */
			var prevScrollpos = window.pageYOffset;
			window.onscroll = function() {
				var currentScrollPos = window.pageYOffset;								
				
				var x = window.matchMedia("(min-width: 1851px)")
				if(x.matches) {
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/

					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
				else{
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/
					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
					/* 	document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
			
				if(currentScrollPos == "0.0") {
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "0.5em";
					<!-- document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = 'auto'; -->
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0.8em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "auto";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "40em";
				}
				if (prevScrollpos > currentScrollPos) {
					
				} else {					
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.cssText += 'height:auto;';
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "-1.0em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "2.5em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "100%";					
				}
				prevScrollpos = currentScrollPos;
			}
		</script></footer></main>

{"prefetch":[{"source":"document","where":{"and":[{"href_matches":"\/*"},{"not":{"href_matches":["\/wp-*.php","\/wp-admin\/*","\/wp-content\/uploads\/*","\/wp-content\/*","\/wp-content\/plugins\/*","\/wp-content\/themes\/twentytwentyfour\/*","\/*\\?(.+)"]}},{"not":{"selector_matches":"a[rel~=\"nofollow\"]"}},{"not":{"selector_matches":".no-prefetch, .no-prefetch a"}}]},"eagerness":"conservative"}]}

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

				<!-- Parallax Layers --></p>

  <div class="title">Sofie‚Äôs Blog</div>

 <section id="Blog" class="Blog" style="Padding: 0 0 0 0">
<div class="container">															



<main class="wp-block-group is-layout-flow wp-block-group-is-layout-flow">
<div class="wp-block-group has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-group-is-layout-constrained">
<div style="height:var(--wp--preset--spacing--50)" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full avatarBlog"><img width="145" height="145" src="http://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Blog.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-33"/></figure>


<div class="BlogTitleClass wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2023-06-15T00:18:00+00:00">15 June 2023</time></div>

<figure class="BlogImageClass wp-block-post-featured-image"><img width="1080" height="1080" src="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2023_06_15_odsc.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="Banner for the ODSC talk" style="object-fit:cover;" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2023_06_15_odsc.png 1080w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2023_06_15_odsc-300x300.png 300w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2023_06_15_odsc-1024x1024.png 1024w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2023_06_15_odsc-150x150.png 150w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2023_06_15_odsc-768x768.png 768w" sizes="(max-width: 1080px) 100vw, 1080px" /></figure>

<h2 class="has-text-align-center wp-block-post-title">spaCy: A customizable NLP toolkit designed for developers</h2></div>


<div class="entry-content BlogTextClass wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><p>In this talk, I first give an overview of the built-in functionality available in spaCy, using pretrained supervised models. I showcase how linguistic information such as part-of-speech tags and dependency parses can help you identify interesting patterns or phrases in your documents and ultimately perform document classification or other information retrieval tasks.</p>
<p>In the second part of the talk, I switch gears and showcase how Large Language Models (LLMs) can be integrated into your NLP pipelines. Due to their impressive natural language capabilities, recent LLMs like GPT-4 are paving the way for fast prototyping of NLP applications in any business domain. Most practical use-cases however will benefit from a structured, pipeline approach in which LLMs can be complemented with supervised models or even rule-based approaches. I showcase how to build such pipelines for a realistic business application, using spaCy and its recently published extension &#8216;spacy-llm&#8217;.</p>
<p>Finally, I discuss how to manage different (and often conflicting) performance features such as accuracy, speed, memory usage, reliability, maintainability and customizability of your NLP solutions, and how you can transform a quick prototype into a robust production-ready solution.</p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Venue</b>: ODSC Europe (London, UK)</p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Slides</b>: <a href="https://speakerdeck.com/sofievl/2023-06-15-odsc" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Speakerdeck</a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
</section>

		<script>
			const tl = gsap.timeline({
				scrollTrigger: {
					trigger: "#hero",
					start: "top top",
					end: "bottom top",
					scrub: true
				}
			});

			gsap.utils.toArray(".parallax").forEach(layer => {
				const depth = layer.dataset.depth;
				const movement = -(layer.offsetHeight * depth)
				tl.to(layer, {y: movement, ease: "none"}, 0)
			});
		</script>
		
		<script>
			/* When the user scrolls down, hide the navbar. When the user scrolls up, show the navbar */
			var prevScrollpos = window.pageYOffset;
			window.onscroll = function() {
				var currentScrollPos = window.pageYOffset;								
				
				var x = window.matchMedia("(min-width: 1851px)")
				if(x.matches) {
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/

					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
				else{
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/
					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
					/* 	document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
			
				if(currentScrollPos == "0.0") {
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "0.5em";
					<!-- document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = 'auto'; -->
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0.8em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "auto";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "40em";
				}
				if (prevScrollpos > currentScrollPos) {
					
				} else {					
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.cssText += 'height:auto;';
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "-1.0em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "2.5em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "100%";					
				}
				prevScrollpos = currentScrollPos;
			}
		</script></footer></main>

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

<div class="BlogTitleClass wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2022-12-20T00:23:00+00:00">20 December 2022</time></div>

<figure class="BlogImageClass wp-block-post-featured-image"><img width="1280" height="675" src="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2022_12_20_ML_success.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="A schema representing an iterative cycle with 5 steps: &quot;product vision&quot; -&gt; &quot;accuracy estimate&quot; -&gt; &quot;training &amp; evaluation&quot; -&gt; &quot;labelled data&quot; -&gt; &quot;annotation scheme&quot; -&gt; back to &quot;product vision&quot;" style="object-fit:cover;" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2022_12_20_ML_success.png 1280w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2022_12_20_ML_success-300x158.png 300w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2022_12_20_ML_success-1024x540.png 1024w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2022_12_20_ML_success-768x405.png 768w" sizes="(max-width: 1280px) 100vw, 1280px" /></figure>

<h2 class="has-text-align-center wp-block-post-title">How to maximize probability of success for your Machine Learning solution?</h2></div>


<div class="entry-content BlogTextClass wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><p>Throughout my 15 years as data scientist in academia, big pharma and through consulting, one common theme has emerged: the most reliable predictor of success for any NLP or ML-based solution is whether or not you involve the data science team early on. By introducing your data scientists to the domain experts right from the start of the project, you can iteratively refine and improve both your data and your ML models.<span style="font-weight: 400;"><br />
</span></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Full article</b>: <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/setting-your-ml-project-up-success-sofie-van-landeghem/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">LinkedIn</a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
</section>

		<script src="/assets/js/jquery.min.js"></script>
		<script src="/assets/js/jquery.dropotron.min.js"></script>

		<script src="/assets/js/breakpoints.min.js"></script>
		<script src="/assets/js/util.js"></script>

		<script src="https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/s.cdpn.io/16327/gsap-latest-beta.min.js?r=5426"></script>
		<script src="https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/s.cdpn.io/16327/ScrollTrigger.min.js"></script>
		<script src="https://frogcat.github.io/canvas-arrow/canvas-arrow.js"></script>
		
		<script>
			const tl = gsap.timeline({
				scrollTrigger: {
					trigger: "#hero",
					start: "top top",
					end: "bottom top",
					scrub: true
				}
			});

			gsap.utils.toArray(".parallax").forEach(layer => {
				const depth = layer.dataset.depth;
				const movement = -(layer.offsetHeight * depth)
				tl.to(layer, {y: movement, ease: "none"}, 0)
			});
		</script>
		
		<script>
			/* When the user scrolls down, hide the navbar. When the user scrolls up, show the navbar */
			var prevScrollpos = window.pageYOffset;
			window.onscroll = function() {
				var currentScrollPos = window.pageYOffset;								
				
				var x = window.matchMedia("(min-width: 1851px)")
				if(x.matches) {
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/

					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
				else{
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/
					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
					/* 	document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
			
				if(currentScrollPos == "0.0") {
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "0.5em";
					<!-- document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = 'auto'; -->
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0.8em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "auto";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "40em";
				}
				if (prevScrollpos > currentScrollPos) {
					
				} else {					
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.cssText += 'height:auto;';
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "-1.0em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "2.5em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "100%";					
				}
				prevScrollpos = currentScrollPos;
			}
		</script></footer></main>
</div>
<script type="speculationrules">
{"prefetch":[{"source":"document","where":{"and":[{"href_matches":"\/*"},{"not":{"href_matches":["\/wp-*.php","\/wp-admin\/*","\/wp-content\/uploads\/*","\/wp-content\/*","\/wp-content\/plugins\/*","\/wp-content\/themes\/twentytwentyfour\/*","\/*\\?(.+)"]}},{"not":{"selector_matches":"a[rel~=\"nofollow\"]"}},{"not":{"selector_matches":".no-prefetch, .no-prefetch a"}}]},"eagerness":"conservative"}]}

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>
</body>
</html>

<style id='wp-block-template-skip-link-inline-css'>

		.skip-link.screen-reader-text {
			border: 0;
			clip-path: inset(50%);
			height: 1px;
			margin: -1px;
			overflow: hidden;
			padding: 0;
			position: absolute !important;

		.skip-link.screen-reader-text:focus {
			background-color: #eee;
			clip-path: none;

<main class="wp-block-group is-layout-flow wp-block-group-is-layout-flow">
<div class="wp-block-group has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-group-is-layout-constrained">

<figure class="wp-block-image size-full avatarBlog"><img width="145" height="145" src="http://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Blog.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-33"/></figure>


<div class="BlogTitleClass wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2022-12-19T10:39:00+00:00">19 December 2022</time></div>

<figure class="BlogImageClass wp-block-post-featured-image"><img width="3024" height="1510" src="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2022_12_19_arxiv.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="Schema showing how various ortographic features are embedded in one long vector." style="object-fit:cover;" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2022_12_19_arxiv.png 3024w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2022_12_19_arxiv-300x150.png 300w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2022_12_19_arxiv-1024x511.png 1024w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2022_12_19_arxiv-768x383.png 768w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2022_12_19_arxiv-1536x767.png 1536w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2022_12_19_arxiv-2048x1023.png 2048w" sizes="(max-width: 3024px) 100vw, 3024px" /></figure>

<h2 class="has-text-align-center wp-block-post-title">Multi hash embeddings in spaCy</h2></div>


<div class="entry-content BlogTextClass wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><p>The distributed representation of symbols is one of the key technologies in machine learning systems today, playing a pivotal role in modern natural language processing. Traditional word embeddings associate a separate vector with each word. While this approach is simple and leads to good performance, it requires a lot of memory for representing a large vocabulary.</p>
<p>To reduce the memory footprint, the default embedding layer in spaCy is a hash embeddings layer. It is a stochastic approximation of traditional embeddings that provides unique vectors for a large number of words without explicitly storing a separate vector for each of them. To be able to compute meaningful representations for both known and unknown words, hash embeddings represent each word as a summary of the normalized word form, subword information and word shape. Together, these features produce a multi-embedding of a word.</p>
<p>In this technical report we lay out a bit of history and introduce the embedding methods in spaCy in detail. Second, we critically evaluate the hash embedding architecture with multi-embeddings on Named Entity Recognition datasets from a variety of domains and languages. The experiments validate most key design choices behind spaCy&#8217;s embedders, but we also uncover a few surprising results.</p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Paper</b>: <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2212.09255" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Arxiv</a></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Authors</b>: Lester James Miranda, √Åkos K√°d√°r, Adriane Boyd, Sofie Van Landeghem, Anders S√∏gaard, Matthew Honnibal</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
</section>

		<script>
			const tl = gsap.timeline({
				scrollTrigger: {
					trigger: "#hero",
					start: "top top",
					end: "bottom top",
					scrub: true
				}
			});

			gsap.utils.toArray(".parallax").forEach(layer => {
				const depth = layer.dataset.depth;
				const movement = -(layer.offsetHeight * depth)
				tl.to(layer, {y: movement, ease: "none"}, 0)
			});
		</script>
		
		<script>
			/* When the user scrolls down, hide the navbar. When the user scrolls up, show the navbar */
			var prevScrollpos = window.pageYOffset;
			window.onscroll = function() {
				var currentScrollPos = window.pageYOffset;								
				
				var x = window.matchMedia("(min-width: 1851px)")
				if(x.matches) {
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/

					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
				else{
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/
					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
					/* 	document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
			
				if(currentScrollPos == "0.0") {
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "0.5em";
					<!-- document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = 'auto'; -->
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0.8em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "auto";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "40em";
				}
				if (prevScrollpos > currentScrollPos) {
					
				} else {					
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.cssText += 'height:auto;';
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "-1.0em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "2.5em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "100%";					
				}
				prevScrollpos = currentScrollPos;
			}
		</script></footer></main>

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

  <div class="title">Sofie‚Äôs Blog</div>

 <section id="Blog" class="Blog" style="Padding: 0 0 0 0">
<div class="container">															



<main class="wp-block-group is-layout-flow wp-block-group-is-layout-flow">
<div class="wp-block-group has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-group-is-layout-constrained">
<div style="height:var(--wp--preset--spacing--50)" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full avatarBlog"><img width="145" height="145" src="http://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Blog.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-33"/></figure>


<div class="BlogTitleClass wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2022-10-06T10:56:00+00:00">6 October 2022</time></div>

<figure class="BlogImageClass wp-block-post-featured-image"><img width="1708" height="628" src="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2022_10_06_coref.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="Example of coreference in a sentence: &quot;Philip plays the bass because he loves it.&quot; -&gt; &quot;Philip and &quot;he&quot; are coreferent, and &quot;the bass&quot; and &quot;it&quot; are coreferent as well." style="object-fit:cover;" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2022_10_06_coref.png 1708w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2022_10_06_coref-300x110.png 300w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2022_10_06_coref-1024x377.png 1024w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2022_10_06_coref-768x282.png 768w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2022_10_06_coref-1536x565.png 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 1708px) 100vw, 1708px" /></figure>

<h2 class="has-text-align-center wp-block-post-title">End-to-end Neural Coreference Resolution in spaCy</h2></div>


<div class="entry-content BlogTextClass wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><p>This blog post introduces a novel coreference implementation for spaCy.</p>
<p>To understand the task of coreference, consider a fictional story populated by various characters. Throughout the story,  these characters appear in various locations and face a variety of situations, as well as each other. The narrator refers to these characters, places and events in all sorts of ways. Similarly, authors of news articles, restaurant reviews or scientific articles refer to various different kinds of buildings, festivals, drug treatments and much more. Our everyday discourse with colleagues, friends and family is comprised of mentioning various things and then referring back to those things in a different way at a later time.</p>
<p>When an entity or an event has already been introduced in the discourse and we mention it later, that‚Äôs called coreference. In other words, when two expressions refer to the same thing, we say that they corefer.</p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The coreference resolution system we release in spacy-experimental v0.6.0 is an end-to-end neural system applicable across a wide variety of entity coreference problems. We‚Äôve based our implementation on a recent incarnation of the neural paradigm published in the paper &#8220;Word-Level Coreference Resolution&#8221; by Vladimir Dobrovolskii, which was published in EMNLP 2021. We&#8217;ve also released the transformer-based English coreference pipeline trained on OntoNotes, which we currently call en_coreference_web_trf. You can find it <a href="https://github.com/explosion/spacy-experimental/releases/tag/v0.6.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener">here</a>, and example training code can be consulted <a href="https://github.com/explosion/projects/tree/v3/experimental/coref" target="_blank" rel="noopener">here</a>.<br />
</span></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  </b><strong>Authors</strong>: √Åkos K√°d√°r, Paul O‚ÄôLeary McCann, Richard Hudson, Edward Schmuhl, Sofie Van Landeghem, Adriane Boyd, Madeesh Kannan, Victoria Slocum</p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Blog post</b>: <a href="https://explosion.ai/blog/coref" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Full post</a></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  </b><strong>Original paper by Dobrovolskii</strong>: <a href="https://aclanthology.org/2021.emnlp-main.605/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">EMNLP 2021</a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
</section>

		<script>
			const tl = gsap.timeline({
				scrollTrigger: {
					trigger: "#hero",
					start: "top top",
					end: "bottom top",
					scrub: true
				}
			});

			gsap.utils.toArray(".parallax").forEach(layer => {
				const depth = layer.dataset.depth;
				const movement = -(layer.offsetHeight * depth)
				tl.to(layer, {y: movement, ease: "none"}, 0)
			});
		</script>
		
		<script>
			/* When the user scrolls down, hide the navbar. When the user scrolls up, show the navbar */
			var prevScrollpos = window.pageYOffset;
			window.onscroll = function() {
				var currentScrollPos = window.pageYOffset;								
				
				var x = window.matchMedia("(min-width: 1851px)")
				if(x.matches) {
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/

					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
				else{
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/
					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
					/* 	document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
			
				if(currentScrollPos == "0.0") {
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "0.5em";
					<!-- document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = 'auto'; -->
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0.8em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "auto";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "40em";
				}
				if (prevScrollpos > currentScrollPos) {
					
				} else {					
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.cssText += 'height:auto;';
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "-1.0em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "2.5em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "100%";					
				}
				prevScrollpos = currentScrollPos;
			}
		</script></footer></main>

{"prefetch":[{"source":"document","where":{"and":[{"href_matches":"\/*"},{"not":{"href_matches":["\/wp-*.php","\/wp-admin\/*","\/wp-content\/uploads\/*","\/wp-content\/*","\/wp-content\/plugins\/*","\/wp-content\/themes\/twentytwentyfour\/*","\/*\\?(.+)"]}},{"not":{"selector_matches":"a[rel~=\"nofollow\"]"}},{"not":{"selector_matches":".no-prefetch, .no-prefetch a"}}]},"eagerness":"conservative"}]}
