<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

<figure class="BlogImageClass wp-block-post-featured-image"><img width="1009" height="495" src="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2022_06_14_spancat.jpg" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="Example of a text snippet showing overlapping spans, such as &quot;bacteremia&quot; being a &quot;Condition&quot;, but also part of a larger phrase labeled as &quot;Factor&quot;: &quot;bacteremia originating from lower respiratory tract infection&quot;." style="object-fit:cover;" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2022_06_14_spancat.jpg 1009w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2022_06_14_spancat-300x147.jpg 300w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2022_06_14_spancat-768x377.jpg 768w" sizes="(max-width: 1009px) 100vw, 1009px" /></figure>

<h2 class="has-text-align-center wp-block-post-title">Spancat: a new approach for span labeling</h2></div>


<div class="entry-content BlogTextClass wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The SpanCategorizer is a new spaCy component that answers the NLP community‚Äôs need to have structured annotation for a wide variety of labeled spans, including long phrases, non-named entities, or overlapping annotations. In this blog post, we talk more about spancat and showcase new features to help with your span labeling needs!</span></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Authors:</b> Edward Schmuhl, Lj Miranda, √Åkos K√°d√°r, Sofie Van Landeghem, Adriane Boyd</p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Blog post</b>: <a href="https://explosion.ai/blog/spancat" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Full post</a></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  API</b>: <a href="https://spacy.io/api/spancategorizer" target="_blank" rel="noopener">spaCy docs</a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>

		<script>
			const tl = gsap.timeline({
				scrollTrigger: {
					trigger: "#hero",
					start: "top top",
					end: "bottom top",
					scrub: true
				}
			});

			gsap.utils.toArray(".parallax").forEach(layer => {
				const depth = layer.dataset.depth;
				const movement = -(layer.offsetHeight * depth)
				tl.to(layer, {y: movement, ease: "none"}, 0)
			});
		</script>
		
		<script>
			/* When the user scrolls down, hide the navbar. When the user scrolls up, show the navbar */
			var prevScrollpos = window.pageYOffset;
			window.onscroll = function() {
				var currentScrollPos = window.pageYOffset;								
				
				var x = window.matchMedia("(min-width: 1851px)")
				if(x.matches) {
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/

					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
				else{
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/
					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
					/* 	document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
			
				if(currentScrollPos == "0.0") {
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "0.5em";
					<!-- document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = 'auto'; -->
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0.8em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "auto";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "40em";
				}
				if (prevScrollpos > currentScrollPos) {
					
				} else {					
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.cssText += 'height:auto;';
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "-1.0em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "2.5em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "100%";					
				}
				prevScrollpos = currentScrollPos;
			}
		</script></footer></main>

{"prefetch":[{"source":"document","where":{"and":[{"href_matches":"\/*"},{"not":{"href_matches":["\/wp-*.php","\/wp-admin\/*","\/wp-content\/uploads\/*","\/wp-content\/*","\/wp-content\/plugins\/*","\/wp-content\/themes\/twentytwentyfour\/*","\/*\\?(.+)"]}},{"not":{"selector_matches":"a[rel~=\"nofollow\"]"}},{"not":{"selector_matches":".no-prefetch, .no-prefetch a"}}]},"eagerness":"conservative"}]}

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

				<!-- Parallax Layers --></p>

 <section id="Blog" class="Blog" style="Padding: 0 0 0 0">
<div class="container">															



<main class="wp-block-group is-layout-flow wp-block-group-is-layout-flow">
<div class="wp-block-group has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-group-is-layout-constrained">

<figure class="wp-block-image size-full avatarBlog"><img width="145" height="145" src="http://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Blog.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-33"/></figure>


<div class="BlogTitleClass wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2021-02-01T11:15:00+00:00">1 February 2021</time></div>

<figure class="BlogImageClass wp-block-post-featured-image"><img width="2000" height="670" src="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2021_02_01_spacy_v3.jpg" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="3.0 banner" style="object-fit:cover;" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2021_02_01_spacy_v3.jpg 2000w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2021_02_01_spacy_v3-300x101.jpg 300w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2021_02_01_spacy_v3-1024x343.jpg 1024w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2021_02_01_spacy_v3-768x257.jpg 768w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2021_02_01_spacy_v3-1536x515.jpg 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 2000px) 100vw, 2000px" /></figure>

<h2 class="has-text-align-center wp-block-post-title">spaCy v3.0</h2></div>


<div class="entry-content BlogTextClass wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><p>spaCy v3.0 is a huge release! It features new transformer-based pipelines that get spaCy‚Äôs accuracy right up to the current state-of-the-art, and a new workflow system to help you take projects from prototype to production. It‚Äôs much easier to configure and train your pipeline, and there are lots of new and improved integrations with the rest of the NLP ecosystem.</p>
<p>Our main aim with the release is to make it easier to bring your own models into spaCy, especially state-of-the-art models like transformers. You can write models powering spaCy components in frameworks like PyTorch or TensorFlow, using our awesome new configuration system to describe all of your settings. And since modern NLP workflows often consist of multiple steps, there‚Äôs a new workflow system to help you keep your work organized.</p>
<p>Enjoy!</p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Authors</b>: Matthew Honnibal, Ines Montani, Sofie Van Landeghem, Adriane Boyd</p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Blog post</b>: <a href="https://explosion.ai/blog/spacy-v3" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Full post</a></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Repo</b>: <a href="https://github.com/explosion/spaCy" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Github</a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
</section>

		<script>
			const tl = gsap.timeline({
				scrollTrigger: {
					trigger: "#hero",
					start: "top top",
					end: "bottom top",
					scrub: true
				}
			});

			gsap.utils.toArray(".parallax").forEach(layer => {
				const depth = layer.dataset.depth;
				const movement = -(layer.offsetHeight * depth)
				tl.to(layer, {y: movement, ease: "none"}, 0)
			});
		</script>
		
		<script>
			/* When the user scrolls down, hide the navbar. When the user scrolls up, show the navbar */
			var prevScrollpos = window.pageYOffset;
			window.onscroll = function() {
				var currentScrollPos = window.pageYOffset;								
				
				var x = window.matchMedia("(min-width: 1851px)")
				if(x.matches) {
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/

					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
				else{
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/
					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
					/* 	document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
			
				if(currentScrollPos == "0.0") {
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "0.5em";
					<!-- document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = 'auto'; -->
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0.8em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "auto";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "40em";
				}
				if (prevScrollpos > currentScrollPos) {
					
				} else {					
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.cssText += 'height:auto;';
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "-1.0em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "2.5em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "100%";					
				}
				prevScrollpos = currentScrollPos;
			}
		</script></footer></main>

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

 <section id="Blog" class="Blog" style="Padding: 0 0 0 0">
<div class="container">															



<main class="wp-block-group is-layout-flow wp-block-group-is-layout-flow">
<div class="wp-block-group has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-group-is-layout-constrained">
<div style="height:var(--wp--preset--spacing--50)" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full avatarBlog"><img width="145" height="145" src="http://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Blog.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-33"/></figure>


<div class="BlogTitleClass wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2020-05-07T14:08:00+00:00">7 May 2020</time></div>

<figure class="BlogImageClass wp-block-post-featured-image"><img width="1200" height="675" src="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2020_05_07.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="Video banner" style="object-fit:cover;" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2020_05_07.png 1200w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2020_05_07-300x169.png 300w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2020_05_07-1024x576.png 1024w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2020_05_07-768x432.png 768w" sizes="(max-width: 1200px) 100vw, 1200px" /></figure>

<h2 class="has-text-align-center wp-block-post-title">Training a custom Entity Linking model with spaCy </h2></div>


<div class="entry-content BlogTextClass wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><p>If your NLP project involves disambiguating textual mentions to different meanings (linked to unique IDs), this new <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8u57WSXVpmw" target="_blank" rel="noopener">video tutorial</a> is for you! I use spaCy, an open-source library for advanced Natual Language Processing in Python, to implement and train a custom Entity Linking (EL) model. I showcase the functionality on an example use-case of disambiguating mentions of the person &#8220;Emerson&#8221; to unique identifiers in WikiData. I accomplish this by first annotating some data with our tool Prodigy, and then training a machine learning model from scratch. Near the end of the video, I show how to use the trained model on unseen text and evaluate the performance.</p>
<p>In summary, these are the steps to succesfully implement Entity Linking:</p>
<ul>
<li aria-level="1">Named Entity Recognition to recognize the textual entities</li>
<li aria-level="1">Create a custom Knowledge Base (KB) that holds information about unique identifiers and likely aliases</li>
<li aria-level="1">Annotate some training text where you manually perform the disambiguation of mentions to their correct KB identifiers
<ul>
<li aria-level="2">Train a new Entity Linking component on your training data</li>
<li aria-level="2">Test its performance on a held-out test dataset</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<p>Hope you have fun implementing Entity Linking with spaCy!</p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí Video: </b><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8u57WSXVpmw" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Youtube</a></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Code (spaCy v2)</b>: <a href="https://github.com/explosion/projects/tree/master/nel-emerson/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Github</a></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Code (s</b><strong>paCy v3):</strong> <a href="https://github.com/explosion/projects/tree/v3/tutorials/nel_emerson" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Github</a></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Blog post</b>: <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/training-custom-entity-linking-model-spacy-sofie-van-landeghem" target="_blank" rel="noopener">LinkedIn</a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
</section>

		<!-- Scripts -->
		<script src="/assets/js/jquery.min.js"></script>
		<script src="/assets/js/jquery.dropotron.min.js"></script>
		<script src="/assets/js/browser.min.js"></script>
		<script src="/assets/js/breakpoints.min.js"></script>
		<script src="/assets/js/util.js"></script>
		<script src="/assets/js/main.js"></script>
		<script src="https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/s.cdpn.io/16327/gsap-latest-beta.min.js?r=5426"></script>
		<script src="https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/s.cdpn.io/16327/ScrollTrigger.min.js"></script>
		<script src="https://frogcat.github.io/canvas-arrow/canvas-arrow.js"></script>
		
		<script>
			const tl = gsap.timeline({
				scrollTrigger: {
					trigger: "#hero",
					start: "top top",
					end: "bottom top",
					scrub: true
				}
			});

			gsap.utils.toArray(".parallax").forEach(layer => {
				const depth = layer.dataset.depth;
				const movement = -(layer.offsetHeight * depth)
				tl.to(layer, {y: movement, ease: "none"}, 0)
			});
		</script>
		
		<script>
			/* When the user scrolls down, hide the navbar. When the user scrolls up, show the navbar */
			var prevScrollpos = window.pageYOffset;
			window.onscroll = function() {
				var currentScrollPos = window.pageYOffset;								
				
				var x = window.matchMedia("(min-width: 1851px)")
				if(x.matches) {
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/

					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
				else{
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/
					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
					/* 	document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
			
				if(currentScrollPos == "0.0") {
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "0.5em";
					<!-- document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = 'auto'; -->
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0.8em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "auto";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "40em";
				}
				if (prevScrollpos > currentScrollPos) {
					
				} else {					
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.cssText += 'height:auto;';
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "-1.0em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "2.5em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "100%";					
				}
				prevScrollpos = currentScrollPos;
			}
		</script></footer></main>
</div>
<script type="speculationrules">
{"prefetch":[{"source":"document","where":{"and":[{"href_matches":"\/*"},{"not":{"href_matches":["\/wp-*.php","\/wp-admin\/*","\/wp-content\/uploads\/*","\/wp-content\/*","\/wp-content\/plugins\/*","\/wp-content\/themes\/twentytwentyfour\/*","\/*\\?(.+)"]}},{"not":{"selector_matches":"a[rel~=\"nofollow\"]"}},{"not":{"selector_matches":".no-prefetch, .no-prefetch a"}}]},"eagerness":"conservative"}]}
</script>
<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>
</body>
</html>

:root :where(.wp-block-post-date a:where(:not(.wp-element-button))){color: var(--wp--preset--color--contrast-2);text-decoration: none;}
:root :where(.wp-block-post-date a:where(:not(.wp-element-button)):hover){text-decoration: underline;}
:root :where(.wp-block-post-featured-image img, .wp-block-post-featured-image .block-editor-media-placeholder, .wp-block-post-featured-image .wp-block-post-featured-image__overlay){border-radius: var(--wp--preset--spacing--20);}
:root :where(.wp-block-post-title a:where(:not(.wp-element-button))){text-decoration: none;}

</style>

<div class="wp-block-group has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-group-is-layout-constrained">

<figure class="wp-block-image size-full avatarBlog"><img width="145" height="145" src="http://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Blog.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-33"/></figure>


<div class="BlogTitleClass wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2020-02-19T14:15:00+00:00">19 February 2020</time></div>

<figure class="BlogImageClass wp-block-post-featured-image"><img width="2910" height="1286" src="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2020_02_19_turku.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="A diagram showing how a spaCy pipeline consists of several components running in sequence: e.g. first a tagger, then a parser, then NER." style="object-fit:cover;" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2020_02_19_turku.png 2910w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2020_02_19_turku-300x133.png 300w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2020_02_19_turku-1024x453.png 1024w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2020_02_19_turku-768x339.png 768w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2020_02_19_turku-1536x679.png 1536w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2020_02_19_turku-2048x905.png 2048w" sizes="(max-width: 2910px) 100vw, 2910px" /></figure>

<h2 class="has-text-align-center wp-block-post-title">Building customizable NLP pipelines with spaCy</h2></div>


<div class="entry-content BlogTextClass wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><p>spaCy is an industrial-strength Natural Language Processing library which allows you to quickly build performant pipelines to tackle specific NLP challenges. It comes with pretrained Machine Learning models for 10 languages and has basic support for over 50 languages. In this talk, I showcase the usage of spaCy as well as give a peak preview on the upcoming spaCy v.3 which will give the user full control over the model internals via configuration files.</p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Venue</b>: Turku.AI Meetup (Turku, Finland)</p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Slides</b>: <a href="https://speakerdeck.com/sofievl/2020-02-19-spacy-pipelines" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Speakerdeck</a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
</section>

		<script>
			const tl = gsap.timeline({
				scrollTrigger: {
					trigger: "#hero",
					start: "top top",
					end: "bottom top",
					scrub: true
				}
			});

			gsap.utils.toArray(".parallax").forEach(layer => {
				const depth = layer.dataset.depth;
				const movement = -(layer.offsetHeight * depth)
				tl.to(layer, {y: movement, ease: "none"}, 0)
			});
		</script>
		
		<script>
			/* When the user scrolls down, hide the navbar. When the user scrolls up, show the navbar */
			var prevScrollpos = window.pageYOffset;
			window.onscroll = function() {
				var currentScrollPos = window.pageYOffset;								
				
				var x = window.matchMedia("(min-width: 1851px)")
				if(x.matches) {
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/

					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
				else{
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/
					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
					/* 	document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
			
				if(currentScrollPos == "0.0") {
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "0.5em";
					<!-- document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = 'auto'; -->
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0.8em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "auto";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "40em";
				}
				if (prevScrollpos > currentScrollPos) {
					
				} else {					
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.cssText += 'height:auto;';
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "-1.0em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "2.5em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "100%";					
				}
				prevScrollpos = currentScrollPos;
			}
		</script></footer></main>

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

<main class="wp-block-group is-layout-flow wp-block-group-is-layout-flow">
<div class="wp-block-group has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-group-is-layout-constrained">

<figure class="wp-block-image size-full avatarBlog"><img width="145" height="145" src="http://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Blog.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-33"/></figure>


<div class="BlogTitleClass wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2019-02-01T14:48:00+00:00">1 February 2019</time></div>

<figure class="BlogImageClass wp-block-post-featured-image"><img width="819" height="552" src="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2019_02_01_tokenization_speed.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="Graph showing the speed of models before and after this PR, showing the boost in speed of this contribution." style="object-fit:cover;" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2019_02_01_tokenization_speed.png 819w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2019_02_01_tokenization_speed-300x202.png 300w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2019_02_01_tokenization_speed-768x518.png 768w" sizes="(max-width: 819px) 100vw, 819px" /></figure>

<h2 class="has-text-align-center wp-block-post-title">Increasing tokenization speed across spaCy&#8217;s core languages</h2></div>


<div class="entry-content BlogTextClass wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><p>One of my first core contributions to the spaCy open-source NLP library!</p>
<p>This PR increases tokenization speed by 2-3 times across languages at the same accuracy by refactoring the regular expressions and replacing `regex` with `re`.</p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Code</b>: <a href="https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/pull/3218" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Github</a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
</section>

		<script>
			const tl = gsap.timeline({
				scrollTrigger: {
					trigger: "#hero",
					start: "top top",
					end: "bottom top",
					scrub: true
				}
			});

			gsap.utils.toArray(".parallax").forEach(layer => {
				const depth = layer.dataset.depth;
				const movement = -(layer.offsetHeight * depth)
				tl.to(layer, {y: movement, ease: "none"}, 0)
			});
		</script>
		
		<script>
			/* When the user scrolls down, hide the navbar. When the user scrolls up, show the navbar */
			var prevScrollpos = window.pageYOffset;
			window.onscroll = function() {
				var currentScrollPos = window.pageYOffset;								
				
				var x = window.matchMedia("(min-width: 1851px)")
				if(x.matches) {
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/

					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
				else{
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/
					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
					/* 	document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
			
				if(currentScrollPos == "0.0") {
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "0.5em";
					<!-- document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = 'auto'; -->
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0.8em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "auto";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "40em";
				}
				if (prevScrollpos > currentScrollPos) {
					
				} else {					
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.cssText += 'height:auto;';
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "-1.0em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "2.5em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "100%";					
				}
				prevScrollpos = currentScrollPos;
			}
		</script></footer></main>

{"prefetch":[{"source":"document","where":{"and":[{"href_matches":"\/*"},{"not":{"href_matches":["\/wp-*.php","\/wp-admin\/*","\/wp-content\/uploads\/*","\/wp-content\/*","\/wp-content\/plugins\/*","\/wp-content\/themes\/twentytwentyfour\/*","\/*\\?(.+)"]}},{"not":{"selector_matches":"a[rel~=\"nofollow\"]"}},{"not":{"selector_matches":".no-prefetch, .no-prefetch a"}}]},"eagerness":"conservative"}]}

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

<figure class="wp-block-image size-full avatarBlog"><img width="145" height="145" src="http://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Blog.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-33"/></figure>


<div class="BlogTitleClass wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2018-06-27T14:51:00+00:00">27 June 2018</time></div>

<figure class="BlogImageClass wp-block-post-featured-image"><img width="1316" height="863" src="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2018_06_27_tasting.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="Picture of Sofie and colleagues testing cocktail recipes" style="object-fit:cover;" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2018_06_27_tasting.png 1316w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2018_06_27_tasting-300x197.png 300w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2018_06_27_tasting-1024x672.png 1024w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2018_06_27_tasting-768x504.png 768w" sizes="(max-width: 1316px) 100vw, 1316px" /></figure>

<h2 class="has-text-align-center wp-block-post-title">Developing a cocktail generator that optimizes your drink to your taste</h2></div>


<div class="entry-content BlogTextClass wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><p>At Foodpairing, we&#8217;re passionate about flavor. In the past few months, I&#8217;ve been working on a revamped version of our cocktail generator. At its core, this cocktail generator has an optimization algorithm that knows which mixers it has at his disposal, as well as which kind of drink a user would like, and then produces a highly personal and super flavorsome mocktail or cocktail as output.</p>
<p>Of couse &#8211; we can&#8217;t just take the algorithm&#8217;s word for it, so today we organized a tasting/testing session of our algorithm together with Peter Coucquyt (co-founder and chef) and Elisa Gragnani (our resident Flavor Insights Strategist). We recreated in real life the cocktails that our algorithm produced on paper, and critically evaluated whether the levels of bitterness, sweetness, floral-ness etc, were all according to the user&#8217;s expectation. Needless to say it&#8217;s been a pretty fun and delicious afternoon at work! If only all algorithm development &amp; testing were this enjoyable!</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
</section>

		<script>
			const tl = gsap.timeline({
				scrollTrigger: {
					trigger: "#hero",
					start: "top top",
					end: "bottom top",
					scrub: true
				}
			});

			gsap.utils.toArray(".parallax").forEach(layer => {
				const depth = layer.dataset.depth;
				const movement = -(layer.offsetHeight * depth)
				tl.to(layer, {y: movement, ease: "none"}, 0)
			});
		</script>
		
		<script>
			/* When the user scrolls down, hide the navbar. When the user scrolls up, show the navbar */
			var prevScrollpos = window.pageYOffset;
			window.onscroll = function() {
				var currentScrollPos = window.pageYOffset;								
				
				var x = window.matchMedia("(min-width: 1851px)")
				if(x.matches) {
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/

					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
				else{
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/
					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
					/* 	document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
			
				if(currentScrollPos == "0.0") {
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "0.5em";
					<!-- document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = 'auto'; -->
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0.8em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "auto";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "40em";
				}
				if (prevScrollpos > currentScrollPos) {
					
				} else {					
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.cssText += 'height:auto;';
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "-1.0em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "2.5em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "100%";					
				}
				prevScrollpos = currentScrollPos;
			}
		</script></footer></main>

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

  <div class="title">Sofie‚Äôs Blog</div>

 <section id="Blog" class="Blog" style="Padding: 0 0 0 0">
<div class="container">

<div class="BlogTitleClass wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2016-01-15T15:04:00+00:00">15 January 2016</time></div>

<figure class="BlogImageClass wp-block-post-featured-image"><img width="2360" height="1529" src="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2016_01_15_gellus.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="Table taken from the paper, showcasing the performance of various models." style="object-fit:cover;" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2016_01_15_gellus.png 2360w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2016_01_15_gellus-300x194.png 300w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2016_01_15_gellus-1024x663.png 1024w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2016_01_15_gellus-768x498.png 768w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2016_01_15_gellus-1536x995.png 1536w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2016_01_15_gellus-2048x1327.png 2048w" sizes="(max-width: 2360px) 100vw, 2360px" /></figure>

<h2 class="has-text-align-center wp-block-post-title">Cell line name recognition in support of the identification of synthetic lethality in cancer from text</h2></div>


<div class="entry-content BlogTextClass wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><h3>Motivation:</h3>
<p>The recognition and normalization of cell line names in text is an important task in biomedical text mining research, facilitating for instance the identification of synthetically lethal genes from the literature. While several tools have previously been developed to address cell line recognition, it is unclear whether available systems can perform sufficiently well in realistic and broad-coverage applications such as extracting synthetically lethal genes from the cancer literature. In this study, we revisit the cell line name recognition task, evaluating both available systems and newly introduced methods on various resources to obtain a reliable tagger not tied to any specific subdomain. In support of this task, we introduce two text collections manually annotated for cell line names: the broad-coverage corpus Gellus and CLL, a focused target domain corpus.</p>
<h3>Results:</h3>
<p>We find that the best performance is achieved using NERsuite, a machine learning system based on Conditional Random Fields, trained on the Gellus corpus and supported with a dictionary of cell line names. The system achieves an F-score of 88.46% on the test set of Gellus and 85.98% on the independently annotated CLL corpus. It was further applied at large scale to 24‚Äâ302‚Äâ102 unannotated articles, resulting in the identification of 5‚Äâ181‚Äâ342 cell line mentions, normalized to 11‚Äâ755 unique cell line database identifiers.</p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Paper</b>: <a href="https://academic.oup.com/bioinformatics/article/32/2/276/1744404" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Bioinformatics</a></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Authors</b>: Suwisa Kaewphan, Sofie Van Landeghem, Tomoko Ohta, Yves Van de Peer, Filip Ginter, Sampo Pyysalo</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
</section>

		<script>
			const tl = gsap.timeline({
				scrollTrigger: {
					trigger: "#hero",
					start: "top top",
					end: "bottom top",
					scrub: true
				}
			});

			gsap.utils.toArray(".parallax").forEach(layer => {
				const depth = layer.dataset.depth;
				const movement = -(layer.offsetHeight * depth)
				tl.to(layer, {y: movement, ease: "none"}, 0)
			});
		</script>
		
		<script>
			/* When the user scrolls down, hide the navbar. When the user scrolls up, show the navbar */
			var prevScrollpos = window.pageYOffset;
			window.onscroll = function() {
				var currentScrollPos = window.pageYOffset;								
				
				var x = window.matchMedia("(min-width: 1851px)")
				if(x.matches) {
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/

					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
				else{
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/
					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
					/* 	document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
			
				if(currentScrollPos == "0.0") {
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "0.5em";
					<!-- document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = 'auto'; -->
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0.8em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "auto";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "40em";
				}
				if (prevScrollpos > currentScrollPos) {
					
				} else {					
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.cssText += 'height:auto;';
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "-1.0em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "2.5em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "100%";					
				}
				prevScrollpos = currentScrollPos;
			}
		</script></footer></main>

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

<style id='wp-block-post-featured-image-inline-css'>

 <section id="Blog" class="Blog" style="Padding: 0 0 0 0">
<div class="container">															



<main class="wp-block-group is-layout-flow wp-block-group-is-layout-flow">
<div class="wp-block-group has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-group-is-layout-constrained">
<div style="height:var(--wp--preset--spacing--50)" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full avatarBlog"><img width="145" height="145" src="http://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Blog.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-33"/></figure>


<div class="BlogTitleClass wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2016-01-05T15:10:00+00:00">5 January 2016</time></div>

<figure class="BlogImageClass wp-block-post-featured-image"><img width="2517" height="1615" src="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2016_01_05_diffany.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="Figure from the paper, showing how differential networks work." style="object-fit:cover;" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2016_01_05_diffany.png 2517w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2016_01_05_diffany-300x192.png 300w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2016_01_05_diffany-1024x657.png 1024w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2016_01_05_diffany-768x493.png 768w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2016_01_05_diffany-1536x986.png 1536w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2016_01_05_diffany-2048x1314.png 2048w" sizes="(max-width: 2517px) 100vw, 2517px" /></figure>

<h2 class="has-text-align-center wp-block-post-title">Diffany: an ontology-driven framework to infer, visualise and analyse differential molecular networks</h2></div>


<div class="entry-content BlogTextClass wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><h4><b>Background:</b></h4>
<p>Differential networks have recently been introduced as a powerful way to study the dynamic rewiring capabilities of an interactome in response to changing environmental conditions or stimuli. Currently, such differential networks are generated and visualised using ad hoc methods, and are often limited to the analysis of only one condition-specific response or one interaction type at a time.</p>
<h4><b>Results:</b></h4>
<p>In this work, we present a generic, ontology-driven framework to infer, visualise and analyse an arbitrary set of condition-specific responses against one reference network. To this end, we have implemented novel ontology-based algorithms that can process highly heterogeneous networks, accounting for both physical interactions and regulatory associations, symmetric and directed edges, edge weights and negation. We propose this integrative framework as a standardised methodology that allows a unified view on differential networks and promotes comparability between differential network studies. As an illustrative application, we demonstrate its usefulness on a plant abiotic stress study and we experimentally confirmed a predicted regulator.</p>
<p>We made the algorithms available as an open-source package, a commandline interface and a cytoscape plugin.</p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Paper</b>: <a href="https://bmcbioinformatics.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12859-015-0863-y" target="_blank" rel="noopener">BMC Bioinformatics</a></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Code</b>: <a href="https://github.com/thpar/diffany">Github repo</a></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Authors</b>: Sofie Van Landeghem, Thomas Van Parys, Marieke Dubois, Dirk Inz√©, Yves Van de Peer</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
</section>

		<script src="https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/s.cdpn.io/16327/gsap-latest-beta.min.js?r=5426"></script>
		<script src="https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/s.cdpn.io/16327/ScrollTrigger.min.js"></script>
		<script src="https://frogcat.github.io/canvas-arrow/canvas-arrow.js"></script>
		
		<script>
			const tl = gsap.timeline({
				scrollTrigger: {
					trigger: "#hero",
					start: "top top",
					end: "bottom top",
					scrub: true
				}
			});

			gsap.utils.toArray(".parallax").forEach(layer => {
				const depth = layer.dataset.depth;
				const movement = -(layer.offsetHeight * depth)
				tl.to(layer, {y: movement, ease: "none"}, 0)
			});
		</script>
		
		<script>
			/* When the user scrolls down, hide the navbar. When the user scrolls up, show the navbar */
			var prevScrollpos = window.pageYOffset;
			window.onscroll = function() {
				var currentScrollPos = window.pageYOffset;								
				
				var x = window.matchMedia("(min-width: 1851px)")
				if(x.matches) {
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/

					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
				else{
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/
					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
					/* 	document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
			
				if(currentScrollPos == "0.0") {
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "0.5em";
					<!-- document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = 'auto'; -->
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0.8em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "auto";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "40em";
				}
				if (prevScrollpos > currentScrollPos) {
					
				} else {					
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.cssText += 'height:auto;';
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "-1.0em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "2.5em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "100%";					
				}
				prevScrollpos = currentScrollPos;
			}
		</script></footer></main>
</div>
<script type="speculationrules">
{"prefetch":[{"source":"document","where":{"and":[{"href_matches":"\/*"},{"not":{"href_matches":["\/wp-*.php","\/wp-admin\/*","\/wp-content\/uploads\/*","\/wp-content\/*","\/wp-content\/plugins\/*","\/wp-content\/themes\/twentytwentyfour\/*","\/*\\?(.+)"]}},{"not":{"selector_matches":"a[rel~=\"nofollow\"]"}},{"not":{"selector_matches":".no-prefetch, .no-prefetch a"}}]},"eagerness":"conservative"}]}

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>
</body>

			background-color: #eee;
			clip-path: none;

			text-decoration: none;
			top: 5px;
			width: auto;

 <section id="Blog" class="Blog" style="Padding: 0 0 0 0">
<div class="container">															



<main class="wp-block-group is-layout-flow wp-block-group-is-layout-flow">
<div class="wp-block-group has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-group-is-layout-constrained">
<div style="height:var(--wp--preset--spacing--50)" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full avatarBlog"><img width="145" height="145" src="http://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Blog.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-33"/></figure>


<div class="BlogTitleClass wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2013-08-09T16:30:00+00:00">9 August 2013</time></div>

<figure class="BlogImageClass wp-block-post-featured-image"><img width="3033" height="1000" src="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2013_08_09_st13.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="Table from the paper, showing the performance of our EVEX submission reaching 50.97% F-score" style="object-fit:cover;" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2013_08_09_st13.png 3033w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2013_08_09_st13-300x99.png 300w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2013_08_09_st13-1024x338.png 1024w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2013_08_09_st13-768x253.png 768w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2013_08_09_st13-1536x506.png 1536w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2013_08_09_st13-2048x675.png 2048w" sizes="(max-width: 3033px) 100vw, 3033px" /></figure>

<h2 class="has-text-align-center wp-block-post-title">EVEX in ST‚Äô13: Application of a large-scale text mining resource to event extraction and network construction</h2></div>


<div class="entry-content BlogTextClass wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><h3>Background:</h3>
<p>Modern methods for mining biomolecular interactions from literature typically make predictions based solely on the immediate textual context, in effect a single sentence. No prior work has been published on extending this context to the information automatically gathered from the whole biomedical literature. Thus, our motivation for this study is to explore whether mutually supporting evidence, aggregated across several documents can be utilized to improve the performance of the state-of-the-art event extraction systems.</p>
<p>In this paper, we describe our participation in the latest BioNLP Shared Task using the large-scale text mining resource EVEX. We participated in the Genia Event Extraction (GE) and Gene Regulation Network (GRN) tasks with two separate systems. In the GE task, we implemented a re-ranking approach to improve the precision of an existing event extraction system, incorporating features from the EVEX resource. In the GRN task, our system relied solely on the EVEX resource and utilized a rule-based conversion algorithm between the EVEX and GRN formats.</p>
<h3>Results:</h3>
<p>In the GE task, our re-ranking approach led to a modest performance increase and resulted in the first rank of the official Shared Task results with 50.97% F-score. Additionally, in this paper we explore and evaluate the usage of distributed vector representations for this challenge.</p>
<p>In the GRN task, we ranked fifth in the official results with a strict/relaxed SER score of 0.92/0.81 respectively. To try and improve upon these results, we have implemented a novel machine learning based conversion system and benchmarked its performance against the original rule-based system.</p>
<h3>Conclusions:</h3>
<p>For the GRN task, we were able to produce a gene regulatory network from the EVEX data, warranting the use of such generic large-scale text mining data in network biology settings. A detailed performance and error analysis provides more insight into the relatively low recall rates.</p>
<p>In the GE task we demonstrate that both the re-ranking approach and the word vectors can provide slight performance improvement. A manual evaluation of the re-ranking results pinpoints some of the challenges faced in applying large-scale text mining knowledge to event extraction.</p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Papers</b>: <a href="https://aclanthology.org/W13-2004/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">BioNLP proceedings</a> and <a href="https://bmcbioinformatics.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/1471-2105-16-S16-S3" target="_blank" rel="noopener">BMC Bioinformatics</a></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Authors</b>: Kai Hakala, Sofie Van Landeghem, Tapio Salakoski, Yves Van de Peer, Filip Ginter</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
</section>

			const tl = gsap.timeline({
				scrollTrigger: {
					trigger: "#hero",
					start: "top top",
					end: "bottom top",
					scrub: true
				}
			});

			gsap.utils.toArray(".parallax").forEach(layer => {
				const depth = layer.dataset.depth;
				const movement = -(layer.offsetHeight * depth)
				tl.to(layer, {y: movement, ease: "none"}, 0)
			});
		</script>
		
		<script>
			/* When the user scrolls down, hide the navbar. When the user scrolls up, show the navbar */
			var prevScrollpos = window.pageYOffset;
			window.onscroll = function() {
				var currentScrollPos = window.pageYOffset;								
				
				var x = window.matchMedia("(min-width: 1851px)")
				if(x.matches) {
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/

					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
				else{
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/
					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
					/* 	document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
			
				if(currentScrollPos == "0.0") {
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "0.5em";
					<!-- document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = 'auto'; -->
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0.8em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "auto";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "40em";
				}
				if (prevScrollpos > currentScrollPos) {
					
				} else {					
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.cssText += 'height:auto;';
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "-1.0em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "2.5em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "100%";					
				}
				prevScrollpos = currentScrollPos;
			}
		</script></footer></main>

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

 <section id="Blog" class="Blog" style="Padding: 0 0 0 0">
<div class="container">															



<main class="wp-block-group is-layout-flow wp-block-group-is-layout-flow">
<div class="wp-block-group has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-group-is-layout-constrained">
<div style="height:var(--wp--preset--spacing--50)" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full avatarBlog"><img width="145" height="145" src="http://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Blog.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-33"/></figure>


<div class="BlogTitleClass wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2013-04-17T16:44:00+00:00">17 April 2013</time></div>

<figure class="BlogImageClass wp-block-post-featured-image"><img width="4117" height="1973" src="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2013_04_17_evex.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="Graphic overview of how a part of the p53 pathway can be reconstructed by analysing textual information on a large scale." style="object-fit:cover;" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2013_04_17_evex.png 4117w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2013_04_17_evex-300x144.png 300w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2013_04_17_evex-1024x491.png 1024w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2013_04_17_evex-768x368.png 768w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2013_04_17_evex-1536x736.png 1536w, https://oxykodit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/2013_04_17_evex-2048x981.png 2048w" sizes="(max-width: 4117px) 100vw, 4117px" /></figure>

<h2 class="has-text-align-center wp-block-post-title">Large-scale event extraction from literature with multi-level gene normalization</h2></div>


<div class="entry-content BlogTextClass wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><p>Text mining for the life sciences aims to aid database curation, knowledge summarization and information retrieval through the automated processing of biomedical texts. To provide comprehensive coverage and enable full integration with existing biomolecular database records, it is crucial that text mining tools scale up to millions of articles and that their analyses can be unambiguously linked to information recorded in resources such as UniProt, KEGG, BioGRID and NCBI databases.</p>
<p>In this study, we investigate how fully automated text mining of complex biomolecular events can be augmented with a normalization strategy that identifies biological concepts in text, mapping them to identifiers at varying levels of granularity, ranging from canonicalized symbols to unique gene and proteins and broad gene families.</p>
<p>To this end, we have combined two state-of-the-art text mining components, previously evaluated on two community-wide challenges, and have extended and improved upon these methods by exploiting their complementary nature. Using these systems, we perform normalization and event extraction to create a large-scale resource that is publicly available, unique in semantic scope, and covers all 21.9 million PubMed abstracts and 460 thousand PubMed Central open access full-text articles. This dataset contains 40 million biomolecular events involving 76 million gene/protein mentions, linked to 122 thousand distinct genes from 5032 species across the full taxonomic tree.</p>
<p>Detailed evaluations and analyses reveal promising results for application of this data in database and pathway curation efforts. The main software components used in this study are released under an open-source license. Further, the resulting dataset is freely accessible through a novel API, providing programmatic and customized access. Finally, to allow for large-scale bioinformatic analyses, the entire resource is available for bulk download from<a href="http://evexdb.org/download/" target="_blank" rel="noopener"> http://evexdb.org/download/</a>, under the Creative Commons ‚Äì Attribution ‚Äì Share Alike (CC BY-SA) license.</p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Paper</b>: <a href="https://journals.plos.org/plosone/article?id=10.1371/journal.pone.0055814" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Plos One</a></p>
<p style="padding-left: 40px;"><b>‚Üí  Authors</b>: Sofie Van Landeghem, Jari Bj√∂rne, Chih-Hsuan Wei, Kai Hakala, Sampo Pyysalo, Sophia Ananiadou, Hung-Yu Kao, Zhiyong Lu, Tapio Salakoski, Yves Van de Peer, Filip Ginter</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
</section>

		<script>
			const tl = gsap.timeline({
				scrollTrigger: {
					trigger: "#hero",
					start: "top top",
					end: "bottom top",
					scrub: true
				}
			});

			gsap.utils.toArray(".parallax").forEach(layer => {
				const depth = layer.dataset.depth;
				const movement = -(layer.offsetHeight * depth)
				tl.to(layer, {y: movement, ease: "none"}, 0)
			});
		</script>
		
		<script>
			/* When the user scrolls down, hide the navbar. When the user scrolls up, show the navbar */
			var prevScrollpos = window.pageYOffset;
			window.onscroll = function() {
				var currentScrollPos = window.pageYOffset;								
				
				var x = window.matchMedia("(min-width: 1851px)")
				if(x.matches) {
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/

					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
				else{
					if(currentScrollPos > 0) {						
						/* document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 0}, 1000);*/
					}
					if(currentScrollPos <= 0) {
					/* 	document.getElementById("HeaderIntro").animate({opacity: 1}, 1000);*/
					}
				}
			
				if(currentScrollPos == "0.0") {
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "0.5em";
					<!-- document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = 'auto'; -->
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0.8em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "auto";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "40em";
				}
				if (prevScrollpos > currentScrollPos) {
					
				} else {					
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.cssText += 'height:auto;';
					document.getElementById("nav").style.top = "-1.0em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.borderRadius = '0em';
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.height = "2.5em";
					document.getElementById("nav").children[0].style.width = "100%";					
				}
				prevScrollpos = currentScrollPos;
			}
		</script></footer></main>

{"prefetch":[{"source":"document","where":{"and":[{"href_matches":"\/*"},{"not":{"href_matches":["\/wp-*.php","\/wp-admin\/*","\/wp-content\/uploads\/*","\/wp-content\/*","\/wp-content\/plugins\/*","\/wp-content\/themes\/twentytwentyfour\/*","\/*\\?(.+)"]}},{"not":{"selector_matches":"a[rel~=\"nofollow\"]"}},{"not":{"selector_matches":".no-prefetch, .no-prefetch a"}}]},"eagerness":"conservative"}]}

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.id = 'wp-skip-link';
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerText = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

<style id='wp-emoji-styles-inline-css'>

	img.wp-smiley, img.emoji {
		display: inline !important;
		border: none !important;
		box-shadow: none !important;
		height: 1em !important;
		width: 1em !important;

  <div class="title">Sofie‚Äôs Blog</div>
